It consists of several species, most notably Schizostemma capense and Schizostemma kirkii, which are native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their tubular, often fragrant flowers and linear leaves. Schizostemma species typically grow in rocky or coastal habitats and are often found in coastal dunes or on cliffs. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their unique appearance.
